meanings.sent1: She showed up to the party looking quite schleppy in her wrinkled shirt.
meanings.sent2: The homeless man had a schleppy appearance with his mismatched shoes.
meanings.sent3: Even though he tried to dress up, he still looked schleppy with his messy hair.
meanings.sent4: The garden after the storm looked like a schleppy mess of fallen leaves and branches.
meanings.sent5: The room was so schleppy that it seemed like a tornado had passed through.

meanings.sent1: Her outfit was so schleppy, it seemed like she got dressed in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The old car had a schleppy appearance with its peeling paint and dented doors.
meanings.sent3: The cake she baked looked so schleppy that it was hard to believe she followed the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The museum's art collection was so schleppy that it felt like a garage sale display.
meanings.sent5: The party decorations were so schleppy that they resembled a child's art project.

meanings.definition: To move or walk slowly and awkwardly.
meanings.sent1: He schlepped his feet along the ground as he walked tiredly home.
meanings.sent2: The old dog schlepped behind its owner on the evening walk.
meanings.sent3: She schlepped her heavy bag up the stairs, huffing and puffing.
meanings.sent4: The snail schlepped its shell across the garden path at a snail's pace.
meanings.sent5: The tired toddler schlepped his favorite toy around the house all day.
